'''Knives''' or '''daggers''' were short bladed tools and weapons used by many different peoples of [[Middle-earth]]. 

== By race ==

=== Elves ===
[[Elves]] made knives, carried them and used in hunting and in war. An Elf-wrought knife was a birthday-gift [[Húrin]] gave [[Túrin]].<ref name=":0">{{Cite DTP|id=UT 1.02.01.051}}</ref> [[Sting]] was made by Elvish smiths,<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 2.04.146}}</ref> probably in [[Gondolin]].<ref name=":1">{{Cite DTP|id=H 05.006}}</ref> [[Curufin]] carried a knife<ref name=":2">{{Cite DTP|id=S QS.19.070}}</ref> called [[Angrist]]<ref name=":3">[[J.R.R. Tolkien]], [[Christopher Tolkien]] (ed.), ''[[The Silmarillion]]'', "Index of Names"</ref> when riding from [[Nargothrond]] to [[Himring]].<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=S QS.19.067}}</ref> [[Mablung]] used a knife to rip the belly of [[Carcharoth]].<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=S QS.19.110}}</ref> [[Legolas]] carried a long white knife<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 2.03.076}}</ref> with a silver haft.<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 3.06.034}}</ref> He used it for "knife-work" during the [[battle of the Hornburg]], killing several enemies.<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 3.07.098}}</ref>

=== Dwarves ===
[[Dwarves]] also forged knives and carried them in battle and during journeys. Angrist was made by the dwarf-smith [[Telchar]].<ref name=":3" /> [[Azaghâl]], [[Lord of Belegost]] used a knife to wound [[Dragons|dragon]] [[Glaurung]] during [[Nirnaeth Arnoediad]].<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=S QS.20.018}}</ref> [[Mîm]] had a long knife with [[Poisoned weapons|poisoned]] runes on its blade.<ref>[[J.R.R. Tolkien]]; [[Christina Scull]], [[Wayne G. Hammond]] (eds.), ''[[The Collected Poems of J.R.R. Tolkien]]'', "185. ''[[The Complaint of Mîm the Dwarf]]'' (1961-62)"</ref> Some dwarves in [[Thorin and Company|Thorin's company]] carried small knives<ref name=":4">{{Cite DTP|id=H 08.111}}</ref><sup>,</sup><ref>{{Cite DTP|id=H 09.002}}</ref> and used them to cut [[spiders]]' threads<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=H 08.111}}</ref> and fight against the spiders.<ref name=":4" />

=== Men ===
[[Men]] used knives since the [[First Age]]. [[Beren]] used Angrist to cut one of the [[Silmarils]] from the [[Iron Crown]] of [[Morgoth]].<ref name=":5">{{Cite DTP|id=S QS.19.086}}</ref> Húrin gave Túrin an Elf-wrought knife was a birthday-gift;<ref name=":0" /> Túrin later gifted that knife to [[Sador]].<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=UT 1.02.01.054}}</ref> [[Andróg]] used a knife to threaten Mîm the Dwarf.<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=UT 1.02.06.013}}</ref> During the fighting in the [[Brodda's hall|hall]] of [[Brodda]] thralls that rebelled against [[Easterlings (First Age)|Easterlings]] used meat-knives, while Easterlings themselves were armed with daggers and swords.<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=UT 1.02.07.036}}</ref>

In later ages [[Númenóreans]]<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=UT 2.01.017}}</ref> and [[Dúnedain of Arnor|Northern Dúnedain]]<ref name=":6">{{Cite DTP|id=LR 1.08.070}}</ref><sup>,</sup><ref name=":7">{{Cite DTP|id=LR 5.01.065}}</ref> forged knives and daggers. [[Pre-Númenóreans|Men]] of [[Agar]] also used knives and a group of knife-men served their Master [[Mogru]].<ref>[[J.R.R. Tolkien]], [[Christopher Tolkien]] (ed.), ''[[The Peoples of Middle-earth]]'', "XVII. [[Tal-Elmar (chapter)|Tal-Elmar]]"</ref> [[Beorn]] had eating knives<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=H 07.093}}</ref> - they were among few things made of metal in [[Beorn's Hall|his hall]].<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=H 07.095}}</ref> Men of Isengard had eating knives as well.<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 3.09.016}}</ref>

[[Hobbits]] also used eating knives.<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=H 01.058}}</ref><sup>,</sup><ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 1.01.134}}</ref> Sometimes they carried knives in their pockets.<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=H 05.072}}</ref> [[Samwise Gamgee|Sam]] had a knife that he used for dressing rabbits.<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 4.04.027}}</ref> [[Éowyn]] equipped [[Meriadoc Brandybuck|Merry]] with a knife in addition to his [[Daggers of Westernesse|Barrow-blade]].<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 5.03.091}}</ref> Long knives were also used by Hobbits as weapons during the [[Scouring of the Shire]].<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 6.08.130}}</ref> Since Hobbits were of smaller stature than Elves or other Men, they could use knives made by Elves or other Men as swords.<ref name=":8">{{Cite DTP|id=H 02.114}}</ref><sup>,</sup><ref name=":6" />

Sometimes knives were used by evil Men or for wicked deeds. [[Denethor]] carried a knife with which in his final despair he tried to kill [[Faramir]].<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 5.07.041}}</ref> Knives were among the weapons used by [[ruffians]] of [[Saruman]],<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 6.08.139}}</ref> one of their leaders had a long knife.<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 6.08.159}}</ref> Saruman himself tried to stab [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]] with a knife, which was stopped by Frodo's [[mithril-coat]].<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 6.08.229}}</ref> Several moments later Saruman was killed by his henchman [[Gríma|Grima Wormtongue]], who used a hidden knife to cut Saruman's throat.<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 6.08.238}}</ref>

=== Orcs ===
Orcs used knives since the [[First Age]] as well. They throwed knives at captured Túrin.<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=S QS.21.048}}</ref> Later [[Orcs of the Misty Mountains]] forged daggers among other tools and weapons.<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=H 04.025}}</ref> Some of the orcs in the orc-band that captured Merry and Pippin were armed with knives.<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 3.03.028}}</ref> One of them had a black knife with a long blade, jagged like a saw-edge.<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 3.03.008}}</ref><sup>,</sup><ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 3.03.029}}</ref> [[Grishnákh]] had an orc-knife<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 3.05.013}}</ref> which is described as a long sharp knife (from [[Peregrin Took|Pippin]]'s point of view)<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 3.03.130}}</ref> and as a short serrated blade with a carved handle, shaped like a hideous head.<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 3.05.012}}</ref> Knives were also used by orcs during the in-fighting in the [[Cirith Ungol|tower of Cirith Ungol]].<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 6.01.029}}</ref> During that fight [[Gorbag]] knifed [[Shagrat]],<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 6.01.046}}</ref> while Shagrat used his  long red knife<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 6.01.052}}</ref> to slain Gorbag.<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 6.01.053}}</ref>

=== Trolls ===
[[William, Tom, and Bert]] planned to use their knives to mince the dwarves before boiling them.<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=H 02.086}}</ref>

== Famous knives ==

* '''[[Angrist]]''' was a knife made by Dwarven smith [[Telchar]]<ref name=":3" /> and wielded by [[Curufin]] and later by [[Beren]].<ref name=":2" /> It could cleave iron iron as wood.<ref name=":2" /> Beren used this knife to cut a [[Silmarils|Silmaril]] from the [[Iron Crown]] of [[Morgoth]].<ref name=":5" />
* [[Daggers of Westernesse|'''Barrow-blades''']] were long daggers<ref name=":9">{{Cite DTP|id=LR 1.08.069}}</ref> or knives<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 3.01.027}}</ref><sup>,</sup><ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 3.09.046}}</ref> made by [[Dúnedain of Arnor|Northern Dúnedain]].<ref name=":6" /><sup>,</sup><ref name=":7" /> They were found in a barrow at [[Barrow-downs]] by [[Tom Bombadil]] and given to [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]], [[Samwise Gamgee|Sam]], [[Meriadoc Brandybuck|Merry]] and [[Peregrin Took|Pippin]].<ref name=":9" /> The hobbits could use them as swords.<ref name=":6" /> Merry used his Barrow-blade to deal a bitter wound to the [[Witch-king]] during the [[Battle of the Pelennor Fields|battle of the Pelennor fields]].<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 5.06.022}}</ref><sup>,</sup><ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 5.06.041}}</ref>
* '''[[Morgul-knives]]''' were [[magic]] blades used by the [[Nazgûl]]. A person wounded by such a blade turned into a [[Wraiths|wraith]].<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 2.01.038}}</ref> The Witch-king used a long and thin Morgul-knife to wound Frodo at [[Weathertop]].<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 1.11.162}}</ref>,<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 1.12.010}}</ref>
* '''[[Sting]]''' was an Elvish knife<ref name=":8" /><sup>,</sup><ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR pr.04.003}}</ref> or dagger<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=H 05.004}}</ref>, probably made in [[Gondolin]].<ref name=":1" /> It was found by [[Thorin and Company]] in the [[Trolls' lair|Troll's lair]] and taken by [[Bilbo Baggins|Bilbo]], who used it as a short sword during his adventures.<ref name=":8" /> Later Bilbo gifted it to Frodo.<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 2.03.054}}</ref> It was used by Sam to wound [[Shelob]].<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 4.10.005}}</ref>
